main event: A shiny, silvery object about 3 feet long fell to the ground in Las Lunas, New Mexico on September 8, 1961.
interesting points: The object was observed by a ground visual sighting.
The report suggests the object may have been a balloon, aircraft, moon, satellite, or astronomical phenomenon.
The observer made no effort to obtain the object.
Meteorological conditions included an inversion between 15 and 150 meters, and the area was within an instrument let down area, but no missing parts, tanks or hatches were reported.
sighted object: a shiny, silvery object about 3 feet long
